A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Quite possibly the worst Star Wars of the series. The aboslute worst thing is the script\, it reads like a bad fanfiction you could get from fanfiction.net\, multiple mary sue characters\, plot holes galore\, bad jokes obviously stolen from comedian's that could tell them better. (There was even a your mama joke... really?) Visually\, the film is the best in the series\, but the bad scripts just kill your suspension of disbelief so hard\, you either want to take a nap or walk out by the time you'r on the casino planet sub-plot line. \n\nAnyways\, I'm done with Star Wars. Disney obviously doesn't care and have mismanaged this priceless property to a bargain bin level of quality. Feels like a slap in the face that they still treat this property as a timeless classic while simultaneously destroying every aspect that made the series timeless in the first place.
